correction_response: This tweet is misleading. It implies that cross-dressing and potential abuse are signs of mental disturbance leading to violent behavior, which is not supported by research. TGNC (transgender and/or gender nonconforming) youth do face higher levels of mental health distress, but this is linked to social and structural barriers, including discrimination and stigma, not inherent to their identities (https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpsyt.2021.720681). Also, the World Professional Association for Transgender Health emphasizes the diversity of gender expressions and identities (https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpsyt.2021.720681). Mental health disorders in children are defined by disruptions in age-appropriate thinking, behaviors, social skills, or regulation of emotions, not by their gender expression (https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/childrens-health/in-depth/mental-illness-in-children/art-20046577).
